episodes.title: Ep 51: The Wild West of Microblading
episodes.summary: Microblading expert Claire Vuillemot is here with everything you ever wanted to know about tattooing eyebrow hairs. Plus: The Oscars beauty police (it's just us), Jess has an infrared "journey," and we share our favorite eye glosses.

episodes.title: Ep 50: Butter, Butter, Butter
episodes.summary: Lisa Price, founder of Carol's Daughter, built a beauty empire from her Brooklyn kitchen—and she's here to share her natural-ingredient knowledge and business know-how. We also find out what's *really* happening with Rihanna's makeup line, Fenty Beauty; enter the dark and scary world of scalp care; and then have a 90s throwback moment.

episodes.title: Ep 49: Evangelism
episodes.summary: Supermodel Linda Evangelista talks "Gianni" (Versace), "Georgie" (Michael), and beauty tips she's learned during her legendary career. Before that, we share highlights from New York Fashion Week, discuss adventures in facial-ing, and obsess about gummy hair vitamins.

episodes.title: Ep 48: Smoky Eye Til I Die
episodes.summary: Makeup genius or life coach? Charlotte Tilbury does double duty, spilling beauty advice and tips for living in this (long-awaited) episode. Prepare to be transformed! Before that, we discuss Neutrogena's newest ambassador; the power of magnesium; and how long your hairdryer has to live.

episodes.title: Ep 47: Warm and Fuzzy
episodes.summary: Leaping Bunny program director Kim Paschen schools us on the state of cruelty-free beauty—and exactly what to know to be a more compassionate customer. Before that, Jess is feeling the London hair scene; Jenn has a special gift for our Fat Mascara listeners (!); and we discuss the beauty benefits of meditation. Ohmmmm.....

episodes.title: Ep 46: Crazy Viral
episodes.summary: Madeline "@mpnails" Poole is in the studio to talk manicures, #nailfie tips, and how polish color trends start. We also dream about having a MAC collaboration, give the final word on when (and how) to apply face oil, and discuss the latest hair color trend.

episodes.title: Ep 45: All In
episodes.summary: Lipstick Queen founder and beauty storyteller Poppy King is offering up major lip service this episode! But first, we take you inside our slumber party with Charlotte Tilbury, tell you how our new year's resolutions are going, and discuss a new hair gadget presented at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas.

episodes.title: Ep 44: Jane Says
episodes.summary: Beauty legend (and Jess's former boss!) Jane Larkworthy dishes on being the beauty director at W and Jane magazines, the rise of "influencers," and the odor-fighting powers of chlorophyll. We also get into hair accessories for grown ups, natural beauty at Nordstrom, and nipple reduction surgery.

episodes.title: Ep 43: Does Pink Make You Puke?
episodes.summary: Urban Decay founder Wende Zomnir manages to appeal to punk rockers, bloggers, cougars, basics, and well...everybody. We ask her how she does it, while still keeping her edge. But first: Let's talk pollution-proof skincare; the state of the mega-salon; and the St. Ives lawsuit.

episodes.title: Ep 42:  It's Gonna Be Dope
episodes.summary: We've got tips, tricks, hacks, and money-savers in our special end-of-the-year episode! BuzzFeed beauty editor Essence Gant shares the top beauty stories of 2016 and predicts the big trends coming in 2017. Plus, the new brand Beauty Pie, secrets from Kim Kardashian's makeup artist, and our New Year's resolutions.

episodes.title: Ep 41: Not Today Satan
episodes.summary: Drag queen Bianca Del Rio is here to throw some shade, explain why surgical adhesive is in his makeup kit, and tell us about his new miniseries on Logo. Before that, let's talk about makeup sponges, get fired up about "post-Trump" haircuts, and find out why Jenn's mole disappeared.

episodes.title: Ep 40: Purple Mist
episodes.summary: Smell that? Its fragrance legend Jo Malone— here to tell us about her new book, the Jo Loves brand, and how she creates perfume using all her senses. We also have some deep thoughts on what age is the right age to start wearing makeup, the "French Face," and holiday candles.

episodes.title: Ep 39: Popaholics
episodes.summary: Sandra Lee, MD—better known as Dr. Pimple Popper—takes us into her weird, wild world of blackheads, cysts, and lypomas and shares the technique for a perfect pimple pop. Plus, after a month of testing 2016's top-selling drugstore mascaras, we can finally reveal our favorites, including a  few surprises! We also remember to be beautiful inside and out thanks to rock goddess Shirley Manson and talk about how sanitary (or not) it is to use retail makeup testers.

episodes.title: Ep 38: No Butts
episodes.summary: Lets all give thanks to tattoo artist Virginia Elwood, who takes us behind the scenes of the fascinating (and sometimes intimidating) world of tattoos. Plus, thoughts on micellar waters, why Bill Gates is getting involved in the fragrance industry, and some day-to-night makeup tricks to get everybody through holiday party season.

episodes.title: Ep 37: The Dark Knight of Beauty
episodes.summary: Enter the beauty black market with your guide Gregg Marrazzo, Senior Vice President, Deputy General Counsel for the Estée Lauder Companies. But before we crack any crimes, we'll talk about the new "combination hair" type; politics and perfume; and solutions for beard burn.

episodes.title: Ep 36: One of Us
episodes.summary: Emily Kate Warren went from reporting on the looks to creating them: She now works as a pro makeup artist and hair stylist in Los Angeles. Emily tells us about life on both sides of the biz, as well as her women's creative collective, boxcar+muse. Before that: Press trip field notes; men and makeup; and the deal on "activated" charcoal.

episodes.title: Ep 35: A Pail of Diamond Dust
episodes.summary: We are going green for Halloween! Beauty entrepreneur Tata Harper is here to tell us about her natural skincare line, the coyotes on her farm, and the Tata way to apply blush. Plus, we share what we'll be doing on Oct 31, discover a surprising cause of back pimples, and find out what's hiding under long nails. Scary stuff!

episodes.title: Ep 34: The Lashes Chose Me
episodes.summary: Mary Schook, aka The  Beauty Fixer, introduces us to crazy skincare products from around the word (liquid micro-needles! silk worm cocoons!). Plus, How Botox gets made, thoughts on colored contacts, and our Refinery 29 Beauty Innovator nomination!

episodes.title: Ep 33: Self Lovery
episodes.summary: Actress Dascha Polanco (Orange Is the New Black, Joy) teaches us how to be more confident, smell delicious, and make our butts look amazing. Before that, Jenn & Jess discuss their wild weekend, lessons from Lauders, why botanical ingredients in skincare are great—but maybe not as miraculous as marketers would have you believe—and the truth about "no-makeup" celebrities.

episodes.title: Ep 32: Women Are Kind of Tribal
episodes.summary: Baller business tycoon and Beautycon CEO Moj Mahdara tells us why vloggers will rule the world—and what her personal brand is all about. Jess shares Beautycon NYC highlights, Jenn learns to say hello like a European, and the girls discuss trichotillomania (hair-pulling) awareness and beauty sleep rituals.

episodes.title: Ep 31: Live from Ludlow House: Stealing Beauty
episodes.summary: When is borrowing or being influenced by hair and makeup from a culture other than your own okay, and when is it wrong? In their first live recorded episode at Ludlow House in NYC, Jess & Jenn host a roundtable with beauty experts Ursula Stephen, Mally Roncal, and Alicia Yoon to discuss cultural appropriation.

episodes.title: Ep 30: Bobbi's World
episodes.summary: Makeup artist and business wiz Bobbi Brown is here, and the advice she shares is basically life-changing. Jess & Jenn also share thoughts on the Marc Jacobs show, chat about the Emmys, skincare expiration dates, and a different kind of green manicure.

episodes.title: Ep 29: Who Doesn't Want to Be a Rainbow?
episodes.summary: Cool-girl hair colorist Aura Friedman talks rainbow hair and her tricks for keeping your color intact. Plus, Jess's new job at Teen Vogue, the best beauty at New York Fashion Week (including one NSFW look), fixes for chicken skin, and a debate about "feminine" washes.

episodes.title: Bonus Ep: Talking Beauty at Strand Bookstore
episodes.summary: Listen in as Jenn talks about challenging beauty standards with authors and podcasters Phoebe Robinson (2 Dope Queens, Sooo Many White Guys), Emily Schultz (Truth & Fiction), Georgia Clark, and Autumn Whitefield-Madrano during a panel she moderated for Strand Bookstore in NYC.

episodes.title: Ep 28: Stick to Red
episodes.summary: Christian Louboutin visits the studio to talk about his beauty line, his new fragrances—and what it was like to sneak into the Moulin Rouge (mais oui!). Also: Jess's adventures in wellness, the downside of dry shampoo, and redhead struggles.

episodes.title: Ep 27: Earth Mother
episodes.summary: Chill out with aromatherapist Amy Galper, who explains how you can use scent to help control your mood (really). Before that: The MTV VMA's best beauty looks; our trip to the Indie Beauty Expo; and lipgloss tips.

episodes.title: Ep 26: It's Otherworldly
episodes.summary: Zanna Roberts Rassi, co-founder of Milk Makeup/stylist/editor/red carpet commentator/Project Runway All Stars mentor, tells us about her insane career and quirky new makeup line. Before that: #FoundationProblems; the skincare product editors are obsessed with; and solutions for women with thinning hair.

episodes.title: Ep 25: 6 ft. Barbie
episodes.summary: The girls rock out with makeup artist Theo Kogan, founder of Armour Beauty and former front woman of the punk band Lunachicks. Plus, the best beauty looks from the Olympics, help for Jenn's bruises, and some real talk about the difference between cosmetics and drugs.

episodes.title: Ep 24: Follow My Nose
episodes.summary: How does perfume get made? Ann Gottlieb, who has created Marc Jacobs perfumes, Dior J'Adore, Axe and Dove deodorant scents, and every Calvin Klein fragrance ever (!), shares her secrets. We also take you behind the scenes of the Pat McGrath Labs #004 launch, give you permission to ignore beauty advice, and answer the age-old question: "Do I need to wear sunscreen if my makeup has SPF?"

episodes.title: Ep 23: You Want The Cushion
episodes.summary: Cosmetic chemist Ni'kita Wilson drops mad scientist knowledge, including how to read an ingredient label, the truth about parabens, and which anti-aging creams are worth the money. Plus: Poetic justice for makeup, what to do if your face is allergic to exercise, and which foods cause acne.

episodes.title: Ep. 22: The Seinfeld of Hair
episodes.summary: Hairstylist Orlando Pita has ruled the industry for the past 25 years. Now he gets real about work ethic, the show that changed his career, and why beauty editors are terrified of him. Plus: The week in beauty biz (special Kat Von D vs. Jeffree Star edition!), the girls get buzzed with cannabis beauty products, and the new "breathable" nail polish.

episodes.title: Ep 21: Cornsilkifying!
episodes.summary: Whether you're going somewhere this summer or just dreaming of travel, get cool tips from Wander Beauty founders Lindsay Ellison and Divya Gugnani. Before that, we talk photo-friendly makeup, plastic surgery shaming, buttne solutions, and we check in on Vicky's lashes.

episodes.title: Ep 20: All the Hair Feels
episodes.summary: Beauty news bonanza! We discuss L'Oreal Beaumojis, Barnes & Noble's new beauty selection, and predict the future of BeautyCon. Plus, we rate our favorite skincare devices. Finally, hairstylist Jon Reyman explains why dry cutting is superior, and the real reason some women seek out dude hairstylists.

episodes.title: Ep 19: Sucking and Filling
episodes.summary: Dermatologist and self-proclaimed fat expert Dr. Paul Jarrod Frank shares all the new ways people are getting rid of fat and cellulite—without dieting. Plus, everything you ever wanted to know about natural oils, why makeup tutorials trigger ASMR (euphoric tingles), and deep thoughts on the mom haircut.

episodes.title: Ep 18: The Word No Woman Likes to Hear
episodes.summary: We sit down with Autumn Whitefield-Madrano, author of the new book, Face Value: The Hidden Ways Beauty Shapes Women's Lives, and try to decode our complex ideas about beauty in under a half-hour. We actually get somewhere. Before that, we discuss undercut hair tattoos and the industry's new fast-beauty model. Plus, we check in on producer/test bunny Vicky's progress using Plume natural lash enhancer.

episodes.title: Ep 17: Beauty Otaku
episodes.summary: We hang with Troy Surratt, makeup artist and founder of Surratt Beauty. He gives us the scoop on his luxe line and breaks exclusive news on the forthcoming Kevyn Aucoin documentary. Also: A visit to Charlotte Tilbury's London boudoir; the way women are shopping now; and Jenn's DIY derm trick.

episodes.title: Ep 16: Literally a Hot Mess
episodes.summary: Investigative reporter Virginia Sole-Smith talks body politics, what it’s like to give someone a Brazilian wax, and which beauty treatments are total bullshit. Plus, vibrating eye massagers, the latest lip filler, and Jenn welcomes Jess to the world of gray hair (yay!).

episodes.title: Ep 15: Lady, Your Nails Are Dry
episodes.summary: We sat down with editorial manicurist Bernadette Thompson, the woman who single-handedly took nail art from the world of hip-hop to high fashion. Seriously, she's worked with everyone from Mary J. Blige to Tom Ford. Before that: Products millennials love; the "Tech Neck" phenomenon; and natural lash enhancers.

episodes.title: Ep 14: We Made It Our Own
episodes.summary: Makeup artist Sir John took a break from creating Beyoncé's next earth-moving look to hang with us. We talk Lemonade, Insta-haters, and the summer beauty hack he swears by. But before that! Jenn's new tattoo, an SPF report card, and if wearing makeup can earn you more cash.

episodes.title: Ep 13: Unicorn Balls
episodes.summary: Kat Von D is in the studio! She talks about bullies, cruelty-free beauty, and the one lip color that looks great on everyone. Plus: Crazy cosmetics in the Smithsonian, a new acne fix, and Calvin Klein gets racy.

episodes.title: Ep 12: The Runway is Marble
episodes.summary: Supermodel Veronica Webb sashays in to talk about makeup, her personal melasma cure, and what it's like to work with Azzedine, Donatella, and, oh yeah, Kanye West. Plus, French girl beauty, Jess's beauty pet peeve, and the cult of Pat McGrath.

episodes.title: Ep 11: Let’s Spill the Real Tea
episodes.summary: They’re here! YouTube stars/beauty besties Patrick Starrr and MannyMua talk about the internet star stigma, vulnerability, and how to (finally!) nail an airbrushed look. Before that: matte lipstick secrets and why face masks are everywhere.

episodes.title: Ep 10: Denim Diapers
episodes.summary: Model and activist Yomi Abiola talks about making the fashion and beauty industry a better place for women. Jess & Jenn mourn Prince and the lack of glamorous men in music today. Plus, floatation therapy, facial guilt, and the best concealers for allergy season.

episodes.title: Ep 9: That Bitch Face
episodes.summary: Get ready for an injection of anti-aging wisdom from the Queen of Botox, dermatologist Patricia "Call Me Pat" Wexler. Plus, the latest celebrity makeup lines; an Earth Day report card for the beauty industry; and Jess & Jenn test drive the new anti-cellulite jeans.

episodes.title: Ep 8:  44 Motorcycles & A Lamborghini
episodes.summary: Kiehl's president Chris Salgardo rides in to share his top skin tips and talk about giving back. Jess & Jenn get out their flower crowns for Coachella, chat about hair down "there", and reveal the best fragrances of the year.

episodes.title: Ep 7: Girl Talk
episodes.summary: Editorial manicurist/jazz artist Deborah Lippmann tells us about her mega-brand, collaborating with Gaga, and even sings a few bars. Also: A serious critique of Kylie's "Gloss" video; the deal with collagen supplements; are perms back?

episodes.title: Ep 6: Fake It 'Til You Make It
episodes.summary: Hair legend Michael Gordon, founder of Hairstory Studio and Bumble and Bumble, talks cool-girl hair. Plus: eye-opening makeup advice from Jess, the state of plastic surgery in the U.S., and why lipstick matters.

episodes.title: Ep 5: Brushes Like Butter
episodes.summary: Bicoastal makeup artist Daniel Martin dishes on the LA vs. NYC look, drag queen secrets, and beauty tips Jess & Jenn have never heard before. Plus, spring cleaning your brushes, halal makeup, and wacky (or maybe not?)face rollers.

episodes.title: Ep 4: Starry Night of Perfume
episodes.summary: The master of scent, Chandler Burr wafts in to discuss the fascinating world of perfume. Jess & Jenn get groovy with energetically charged products, debate Korean beauty products, and peek into the (nightmarish) world of Dr. Pimple Popper.

episodes.title: Ep 3: Get Your Squinch On
episodes.summary: Beachwaver inventor Sarah Potempa teaches us all how to be QVC gazillionaires with amazing hair. Jess & Jenn discuss double chins and Kardashian selfie tips, debate the ethics of gene therapy for cosmetic purposes, and offer final thoughts on fashion month (drink whenever they say goth).

episodes.title: Ep 2: You Can Sit With Us
episodes.summary: Editorial manicurist Miss Pop shares her backstage secrets with Jess & Jenn. Plus, Oscar beauty looks, Caitlyn Jenner's MAC collaboration, and Jess's red lipstick issues.

episodes.title: Ep 1: Childlike Glitter
episodes.summary: On their first episode (!) Jess & Jenn talk naturals with RMS Beauty founder Rose-Marie Swift, plus, Fashion Week trends, gender-free fragrance, and the ass gym.

episodes.title: It's Me, Jess, and Me, Jenn! Bonus Episode!
episodes.summary: To celebrate the launch of Fat Mascara, we're giving you a special bonus episode to get to know Jess & Jenn better!
